segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I can’t believe how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far that the stool is practically tipping over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, encouraging him, like this is perfectly safe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to get hurt, and it’s all because they’re sneaking cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink is clueless, just standing there in the water like it’s normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand how careless everyone is being right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, the stool is about to fall, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just take charge and fix this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is grinning like he’s getting away with something, but he’s one wrong move away from disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this anymore; it’s too frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR
